intro: Stackhousia virgata var. elegans, commonly known as the silky stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
